intro: Leobordea villosa, commonly known as the hairy leobordea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white. Leobordea villosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
